preface.title: Preface
preface.para: TimeAccounting module extends OTRS framework enabling the track of time that agents spend on different tasks, vacations, overtime and sick leaves.

If you have questions regarding this document or if you need further information, please log in to our customer portal at portal.otrs.com with your OTRS ID and create a ticket. You do not have an OTRS ID yet? Register here for free.

section.title: Time Accounting Overview
section.para: It displays for the current logged user a summary of its own working hours per day (month based), vacation days summary, sick leave days, and the distribution of its working hours on each project and tasks.

section.title: Time Accounting Edit
section.para: Allows to set working hours, vacation, sick leaves and overtime leaves on a day basis. The working hours can be set by defining the start and the end dates, or a period of time.
The working hours can be registered per project and task. Pre-filled selection lists are used to speedup the register process and prevent typos.

section.title: Time Accounting Reporting
section.para: Designed for administrators and managers, shows a monthly based timing information summary for each registered user (working hours, overtime leave, sick leave and vacations), as well as timing information summary for each project and tasks (the time spend on each).

section.title: Time Accounting Settings
section.para: Also designed for administrators and managers, it allows the creation of multiple projects and tasks. It also enables the assignment of the users defining their working calendar, working periods (begin date, end date, number of vacation days, hours per week and allowed overtime hours).

section.title: Time Accounting Statistics
section.para: A new statistics type has been added to show working hours based on projects or users.

section.title: Time Accounting Notification
section.para: A notification reminder for agents to insert their working hours (can be configured in SysConfig to define the maximum days without entry to display the notification).

section.title: Toolbar Shortcut For Days Without Time Accounting Entry
section.para: A counter displaying the number of days without registering the working hours can be set in the upper part of the screen (similar to Locked tickets counter or Responsible tickets counter). When clicking on the icon, agents are redirected to the Time Accounting Edit screen, to fill the missing records.

section.title: Time Accounting Registration Enforcement
section.para: Configurable by a SysConfig setting, the system can be blocked, not allowing to perform any actions, if a certain number of days without time accounting registers has been passed (agents are redirected to Time Accounting Edit screen to fill the missing records).

section.title: Mass Entries
section.para: Disabled by default, this feature allows agents to set special time accounting information (such as: on vacation, overtime leaves and sick leave) to multiple days at the same time.

chapter.title: Usage
chapter.para: This package ships default configuration without any restrictions for users based on their permissions. Effectively, agents will be allowed to execute most actions and this can be changed in frontend module registration of specific screens by setting Group and GroupRo keys. In general having "rw" permission allows agents to use all screens while "ro" permissions only allows access the personal overview (Time Accounting Overview) and working hours registration (Time Accounting Edit) screens.

section.title: Create A New Project
section.para: This example shows how to create a new project to register working hours on.

listitem.para: From Time Accounting menu choose "Settings".
Click on "Add Project" from the Actions list in the sidebar, located in the left part of the screen.
In the new screen fill the name of the project and a description if needed (make sure that status is set to "valid").
Click on "Submit" button.
After the redirect to the main Settings window, notice that the new project appears in the project list in the center of the screen.

note.para: Optionally register more projects, repeating the same steps.

section.title: Create A New Task
section.para: This example shows how to create a new task to register working hours on.

note.para: Tasks are available to all projects.

listitem.para: From Time Accounting menu choose "Settings".
Click on "Add Task" from the Actions list in the sidebar, located in the left part of the screen.
In the new screen fill the name of the task (make sure that status is set to "valid").
Click on "Submit" button.
After the redirect to the main Settings window, notice that the new task appears in the task list in the center of the screen.

note.para: Optionally register more tasks, repeating the same steps.

section.title: Add a User
section.para: This example shows how to add an agent to the time accounting.

listitem.para: From Time Accounting menu choose "Settings".
Select a user from the Actions list in the sidebar, located in the left part of the screen.
Click on "New user".
In the new screen fill the comments if needed.
For this example we will leave unchecked "Show Overtime" and "Allow project creation" and we will use the default calendar.
In the period table choose a near date for "Period Begin" (otherwise the user will have to fill several time accounting records, due to the enforcement policy).
Optionally change the "Period End" and leave all other columns with the defaults (for this example).
Click on "Submit" button.
After the redirect to the main Settings window, notice that the new user appears in the user list in the center of the screen.

section.title: Register Your Working Hours
section.para: This example shows how to register the working hours in time accounting.

note.para: A previously added user to time accounting is needed for this example.

listitem.para: Login to OTRS with a proper user.
From Time Accounting menu choose "Edit".

Navigate to the desired date by using the left and right arrows in the "Date Navigation" widget located in the sidebar, at the left part of the screen (navigation is automatic by clicking the arrows). Alternatively a date can be defined with the controls below. Click on "Submit" button within the widget to go to the selected date.
Select a project and task in the first row of the table in the central part of the screen.
Type a comment in the "Remarks" column.
Now fill the working hours. It can be done by setting the "Start" and "End" times in "HH:MM" format or register the period of time in the proper column.

example.title: Setting Working Hours For Two And A Half Hours
example.para: Lets think that the working hours took place from 11:00 AM to 01:30 PM. Set 11:00 for the "Start" column and 13:30 for the "End" column, or alternatively to this, just set 2.5 (two and a half hours) in the "Period" column.

listitem.para: After setting working hours in one or more rows, make sure the "Total" (in the table footer) has the expected value, the sum of all working hours. Then click on "Submit" button on the lower part of the screen.

section.title: Unit Tests
section.para: To ensure the quality of the module, several so-called unit tests were created, to test the functionalities of this module. These unit tests can be run via command line.
ATTENTION: Please never run unit tests on a productive system, since the added test data to the system will no longer be removed. Always use a test system.
Run the package specific unit tests
To run only the unit test which will be delivered with this package, use the following command on the command line:
section.screen: shell> perl bin/otrs.Console.pl Dev::UnitTest::Run --test TimeAccounting shell> perl bin/otrs.Console.pl Dev::UnitTest::Run --directory TimeAccounting
section.para: Selenium unit tests
To run the Selenium unit tests, make sure you have a complete Selenium environment setup in your Kernel/Config.pm file and a running a WebDriver.
section.screen: shell> perl bin/otrs.Console.pl Dev::UnitTest::Run --test AgentTimeAccountingEdit --test AgentTimeAccountingOverview --test AgentTimeAccountingReporting --test AgentTimeAccountingSetting --test AgentTimeAccountingView shell> perl bin/otrs.Console.pl Dev::UnitTest::Run --test Notification/TimeAccounting --test ToolBar/IncompleteWorkingDays
